conclusion: The light source is initially positioned to cast shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
The objects casting these shadows are positioned on a flat surface (the slabs).
Shadows are formed when an object blocks light, creating a region where the light does not reach.
The position and size of the shadow depend on the position of the light source relative to the object and the surface on which the shadow is cast.
When the light source moves to the back left, the shadows will shift towards the front right.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadows will shift towards the front left.
The size of the shadow is influenced by the angle at which the light hits the object.
A lower angle (light source closer to the horizon) results in a longer shadow, while a higher angle (light source closer to overhead) results in a shorter shadow.
Moving the light source to the back will generally increase the angle of incidence, potentially making the shadows shorter if the light source is moved closer to the vertical.
If the light source moves to the back left, Shadow A will shift towards the front right and may become shorter.
If the light source moves to the back right, Shadow A will shift towards the front left and may become shorter.
If the light source moves to the back left, Shadow B will shift towards the front right and may become shorter.
If the light source moves to the back right, Shadow B will shift towards the front left and may become shorter.
If the light source moves to the back left, Shadow C will shift towards the front right and may become shorter.
If the light source moves to the back right, Shadow C will shift towards the front left and may become shorter.
If the light source moves to the back left, Shadow D will shift towards the front right and may become shorter.
If the light source moves to the back right, Shadow D will shift towards the front left and may become shorter.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front right and may become shorter.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front left and may become shorter.
